relevant_findings.general: Alert, oriented X 3, no acute distress
relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric, dry mucous membranes, oropharynx clear, EOMI, PERRL
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, ronchi
relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, distended, bowel sounds present though hypoactive in all quadrants, no organomegaly; diffuse abdominal pain to palpation, negative rebound tenderness or guarding; G tube in place with no erythema or drainage.
relevant_findings.genitourinary: Foley placed with dark amber urine
relevant_findings.extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing, cyanosis, or edema
relevant_findings.neurological: CN II-XII intact, EOMI, symmetric smile, can raise forehead symmetrically, tongue midline, adequate hand grip strength bilaterally; UE flexion to only 40 degrees, cannot flex knees or pick up thighs off bed bilaterally; down-going Babinski bilaterally; grossly normal sensation, inability to elicit Achilles and patellar reflexes bilaterally; gait deferred.
